Submodules¶

mdma.atom module¶

Module for reading and writing snapshots from and to LAMMPS (.atom) file formats. The main class is AtomSnapshot, but some additional functions are defined to provide a simplified interface to this class.

The module defines:

  • AtomSnapshot: the class the defining the file interface to this file format

  • read: shorthand for AtomSnapshot.read_single

  • read_trajectory: shorthand for AtomSnapshot.read_trajectory

  • write: create a snapshot from coordinates to write to disk

  • write_trajectory: shorthand to write a series of coordinates to disk

class mdma.atom.AtomSnapshot(x=array([], shape=(0, 0), dtype=float64), box=None, species=None, time=0)[source]¶

Bases: mdma.snapshot.Snapshot

Snapshot of a system of particles in LAMMPS (.atom) file format.

Interface defined in parent class Snapshot. Further documentation can be found there.

read(path_or_file)[source]¶

Read a snapshot from a file, overwriting any existing data.

Parameters

path_or_file – file stream or path to read snapshot from

Raises

  • NoSnapshotError – if could not read from file

  • RuntimeException – if did not recognise file format

mdma.mpi module¶

mdma.pdb module¶

Module for reading and writing snapshots from and to Protein Data Bank (.pdb) file formats. The main class is PDBSnapshot, but some additional functions are defined to provide a simplified interface to this class.

The module defines:

  • PDBSnapshot: the class the defining the file interface to this file format

  • read: shorthand for PDBSnapshot.read_single

  • write: create a snapshot from coordinates to write to disk

Interface defined in parent class Snapshot. Further documentation can be found there.

mdma.snapshot module¶

Module defining interface for reading and writing snapshots in various file formats.

The module defines:

  • stream_safe_open: a context manager to facilitate parsing both open file streams and paths with the same interface

  • NoSnapshotError: exception raised when a snapshot could not be read from the file

  • snapshot: the class containing the general snapshot interface

exception mdma.snapshot.NoSnapshotError[source]¶

Bases: RuntimeError

Exception raised when not able to read a snapshot from a file.

class mdma.snapshot.Snapshot(x=array([], shape=(0, 0), dtype=float64), box=None, species=None, time=0)[source]¶

Bases: object

Snapshot of a system of particles.

Variables:

n: number of particles d: dimensionality of configuration space x: particle coordinates (n by d container) box: box containing the particles (d by 2 container) species: labels of the particle species (string or container of strings) time: time or frame of the snapshot within a trajectory

property box_dimensions¶

Dimensions of box.

property composition¶

Compositional make up of each species.

property concentration¶

Concentrations of each species.

property coordinates¶

Alias for snapshot coordinates.

copy()[source]¶

Return a deep copy of the snapshot.

property d¶

Dimensionality of configuration space.

property density¶

Density of configuration from box dimensions.

property n¶

Number of particles in snapshot.

property natoms¶

Number of particles in snapshot.

classmethod read_single(path_or_file)[source]¶

Read a single snapshot from the disk.

Parameters

  • cls – derived class defining specific file format

  • path_or_file – file stream or path to read snapshot from

Returns

the snapshot read from disk

Return type

snapshot

Raises

  • NoSnapshotError – if could not read from file

  • RuntimeException – if did not recognise file format

Examples

>>> snapshot.read('snapshot.atom')
<snapshot n=10976 t=0>
classmethod read_trajectory(path_or_file, max_frames=None)[source]¶

Read a trajectory (i.e. multiple snapshots) from the disk.

Example where trajectory.atom is an atom file containing two snapshots: >>> list(read(‘trajectory.atom’, 2)) [<snapshot n=10976 t=0>, <snapshot n=10976 t=1>]

Parameters

  • cls – derived class defining specific file format

  • path_or_file – file stream or path to read trajectory from

Returns

generator iterating through the snapshots in the trajectory

Return type

trajectory (generator)

Raises

  • NoSnapshotError – if could not read from file

  • RuntimeException – if did not recognise file format

property shape¶

Shape of particle coordinates, i.e. [n, d].

property t¶

Time within a trajectory where the snapshot occurs (normally in simulation time units).

property volume¶

Volume of system box.

write(out=<_io.TextIOWrapper name='<stdout>' mode='w' encoding='utf-8'>)[source]¶

Dump the snapshot to a file in LAMMPS (.atom) format.

Parameters

out – file or path to write the snapshot to

mdma.snapshot.stream_safe_open(path_or_file, mode='r')[source]¶

Context manager for parsers which accept an open file stream or a file path to open.

Parameters

  • path_or_file – either an open file stream (in which case the context manager does nothing and returns it) or a path (in which case the context manager will open this, return a stream and then clean up)

  • mode – mode to open file in

mdma.xyz module¶

Module for reading and writing snapshots from and to XYZ (.xyz) file formats. The main class is XYZSnapshot, but some additional functions are defined to provide a simplified interface to this class.

The module defines:

  • XYZSnapshot: the class the defining the file interface to this file format

  • read: shorthand for XYZSnapshot.read_single

  • read_trajectory: shorthand for XYZSnapshot.read_trajectory

  • write: create a snapshot from coordinates to write to disk

Bases: mdma.snapshot.Snapshot

Snapshot of a system of particles in XYZ (.xyz) file format.

Interface defined in parent class Snapshot. Further documentation can be found there.
